snippet: Analysts of the Sudans say that low-level violence is likely to persist because of deep divisions, but that international pressure will keep it from erupting fully.
abstract: Memo From Africa; analysts say that low-level violence between Sudan and South Sudan is likely to persist because of deep divisions, but that international pressure will keep it from erupting fully into a war.
lead_paragraph: Analysts of the Sudans say that low-level violence is likely to persist because of deep divisions, but that international pressure will keep it from erupting fully.

headline.seo: Sudans Caught in Tense Cycle — Memo From Africa
headline.main: Status Quo Between 2 Sudans Is Not Quite War, Not Quite Peace
headline.print_headline: Status Quo Between 2 Sudans Is Not Quite War, Not Quite Peace
